meanings.definition: To strip or deprive of something, especially power or rights.
meanings.sent1: The cruel ruler was devesting the people of their freedom.
meanings.sent2: The court order was devesting the company of its assets.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous leprechaun was devesting the garden of all its colorful flowers.
meanings.sent4: The storm was devesting the coastline of its sand and trees.
meanings.sent5: The magician's spell seemed to be devesting the room of all its furniture.

meanings.sent1: The company was devesting itself of unprofitable branches.
meanings.sent2: The government was devesting the land to return it to the indigenous people.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy was devesting the living room of its scattered toys.
meanings.sent4: The artist was devesting the canvas of all unnecessary colors.
meanings.sent5: The wind was devesting the trees of their leaves in a gentle dance.
